text: @Marisa_C @tom_flaherty @ELTchat That's one for top down V bottom up.
@GlenysHanson @jimscriv Like Gandalf getting them out of the Hobbit hole and onto the quest #ELTChinwag
@TechTeacherCent @jimscriv #ELTChinwag Hands off the class and hands on the small group and individual support.
@jimscriv I can see how autonomy would be interpreted that way, but if done right it requires more involvement and commitment. #ELTChinwag
@TechTeacherCent @EdLaur @ELTIreland Or fire off an email which you invite them to open in class and ask you questions about. #ELTChinwag
@jimscriv @ELTIreland Can be hard to spot unless there is a bit of silence on the teacher's part. #ELTChinwag
@EdLaur @languageeteach @j_s_mitten @ELTIreland #ELTChinwag There also need to be opportunities to present, publish and perform.
@TechTeacherCent @GlenysHanson @languageeteach @ELTIreland Making individual feedback a regular feature is what's needed. #ELTChinwag
@jimscriv @ELTIreland #ELTChinwag "Upgrade"?
@EdLaur @ELTIreland Aye! Flip the content and free up time that way. #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland I think this is where we should be spending most of our time. Going around supporting students individually. #ELTChinwag
@eilymurphy @ELTIreland I'm with you! Make them sweat a bit, but then give little hints, or BIG HINTS, if necessary. #ELTChinwag
@jimscriv #ELTChinwag Is it about getting the pendulum to swing away from the emphasis that was on putting students at ease when learning.
@AnneAstrid @ELTIreland Yep! Learner-led support, rather than pre-digested and regurgitated pre-teaching. #ELTChinwag
@GlenysHanson @TechTeacherCent @ELTIreland Yes indeed! Noticing techniques are a personal favourite of mine. #ELTChinwag
@TechTeacherCent @ELTIreland @GlenysHanson Kids are made to work hard on memorising and gap-fills. Is that still spoon feeding? #ELTChinwag
@languageeteach As we are all post-method, it is probably more of an approach ;) #ELTChinwag
@GlenysHanson @TechTeacherCent Yep! But scaffolded doesn't always have to mean structured. #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland Never heard the label til this #ELTChinwag but the idea of setting challenge and tolerating an element of frustration, yes.
@TechTeacherCent I like a bit of do it messy first and then make it nice, myself. #ELTChinwag
@GlenysHanson @ELTIreland We'll have to check it out. #ELTChinwag
RT @ELTIreland: Ok, first question: as a learner would you rather the challenge of working something out or be guided through step by step?…
@ELTIreland #ELTChinwag Give me the challenge and I'll remember longer.
@GlenysHanson @ELTIreland What's Nurph? #ELTChinwag
@GlenysHanson @ELTIreland #ELTChinwag Hi there!
@j_s_mitten @ELTIreland Hi there! #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland #ELTChinwag is back by popular demand.
RT @ELTIreland: 10 minutes until our #ELTChinwag on Demand High ELT. Don't miss it!
RT @j_s_mitten: @LahiffP @ELTIreland @Jane_Seely @McLaughlinLou @DanielZuchowsky it's definitely an interesting topic for an #ELTChinwag! W…
@Marisa_C Great! Similar to the problems with listening objectives although the same terms don't tend to be applied.
@laIoli @Ashowski Found it! Will be perusing it later.
@laIoli @Ashowski Thanks for the tip! I am always up for a spot of problematising.
@ELTIreland The founding article from that website is here. Have a read https://t.co/9pC2E17lOz
RT @ELTIreland: You still have 3 days to book your place on our Manager Meet-Up taking place on 24th Nov. The theme this time is CPD https:…
@Marisa_C That'd be good. I have been both perplexed and enlightened by discussion to date on the issue of reading objectives #ELTchat
@ELTIreland @Jane_Seely @McLaughlinLou @j_s_mitten @DanielZuchowsky Hadnot heard of this til it was suggested for #ELTChinwag. Interesting!
RT @anzbau: Playing around with AR posters in the sociology department at #UniversityofGlasgow, thanks @vhmdale @iatefl_ltsig & #DigELT2015!

RT @ELTIreland: One week to go! Sign up here for our Management Meet-Up on CPD: https://t.co/ZYjuaTYISU
See you there! https://t.co/QZWYXNf…
RT @ELTIreland: What's the most valuable CPD implemented in your institution? Discuss with us on 24th Nov at our #managermeetup https://t.c…
RT @ELTIreland: Join us for a #ELTChinwag on Demand High ELT, Mon 23rd Nov, 8.30am. Have a read about the topic here: https://t.co/QcbRZeOw…
@Ashowski @laIoli: Grabe's Reading in a Second Language discusses contemporary research and more specific models of reading #ELTChinwag
@Marisa_C Good point, but what can we tell trainees to put in lesson objectives that we are able going to be able to stand over then?
@Ashowski @laIoli Not who, what. The top down / bottom up approach to teaching reading.
@laIoli Along with Skim and Scan it seems. Is anything left to put in lesson objectives but practice?
@ebefl @Liam_ELT What does that mean for lesson objectives?Hard to lay claim to be developing the skill if we can really just practice it.
RT @ebefl: @LahiffP @Liam_ELT I think they can be practised in class...not sure about taught.
@Liam_ELT Do you have this as a PDF?
@Liam_ELT So @ebefl is saying skim & scan are either not teachable or too universal to be worth teaching. Does same go for BU/TD strategies?
@Liam_ELT Another zombie methodology? Perhaps, but does that mean top down strategies are outmoded and don't deserve class time?
@Marisa_C I was starting to think that might be it. Reading for gist would be 100% top down, though. Other type of reading are mixed?
A question that is keeping me up: Is reading for info. (i.e. scanning) a bottom up or a top down reading strategy? #ELTChinwag #eltchat
Hey @Louiseguyett we were talking about transcription of schwa versus / ɪ/. I heard recently that the Irish tend to use /ɪ/ more than in UK.
@whippler Bachelor of Education I.e. Degree people.
@hughdellar @KateLloyd05 @Marisa_C @GlenysHanson And as they are a key measure of quality assurance then at an accreditation level too.
@hughdellar @KateLloyd05 @Marisa_C @GlenysHanson Might just be the illusion of progress but that still beats standing still and stagnating.
@KateLloyd05 @hughdellar @Marisa_C @GlenysHanson I'd add that it is about questioning what you do and looking for answers outside you.
@hughdellar @ELTIreland But like deep reading it'd do you no end of good.
@hughdellar @ELTIreland Like the exercise though. The first 20 mins each day make a dramatic difference if you're a coach potato #ELTChinwag
@GlenysHanson @whippler Not sure we'll chase him up for you and see what can be done. What article is it?
@ELTIreland Night all. Lots of material of though there. #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland @racheldaw18 @j_s_mitten @GlenysHanson @iatefl It'll be my first time going and I'm a non newbie. #ELTChinwag
@racheldaw18 @GlenysHanson @j_s_mitten Will be there with others from @ELTIreland just tweet and we'll direct each other #ELTChinwag
@teacher27 @j_s_mitten @ELTIreland Agreed that CPR should begin at home, if you are in a school that is conducive to it. #ELTChinwag
@GlenysHanson @whippler I think that's because it's on Academia and you have to be signed up to be able to get at the articles #ELTChinwag
@whippler I meant do rather than see. But peer one is great. I'm on for open doors and team teaching. #ELTChinwag
@Marisa_C @GlenysHanson I hold out hope for everyone. I'm just an eternal optimist. #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland I would say Twitter but the tech can be a big barrier so it is conferences on a topic of interest #ELTChinwag
@Marisa_C That a useful one. Thanks for sharing it. #ELTChinwag
@whippler I don't think the theory makes sense til you have seen the practice. #Eltchinwag
@whippler Even BEd people will tell you that you don't become a teacher until you start teaching. #Eltchinwag
@ITLegge Not til they sort out those interactive glasses or something else wearable to think and tweet. #ELTChinwag
@Marisa_C I hear you. My motto for that is "Relish the Challenge" #ELTChinwag Borrowed from Peter Medges
@Marisa_C @ITLegge How is being on a committee for encouraging personal CPD? #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland Little and often is best. To keep you fresh and engaged once a fortnight at least. #ELTChinwag
@GlenysHanson @ELTIreland I haven't really get the hang of the webinars. They ring very hollow most of the time. #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland It's part of a work / life / development balance. You have to be prepared to spend on it, but it pays off. #ELTChinwag
@ITLegge @ELTIreland @EAPstephen What are you reading at the mo? #ELTChinwag (When not Chinwagging)
@ELTIreland The one you are forced to do. Encouragement is needed, but if it is against the will the affective filter is down. #ELTChinwag
@ITLegge @ELTIreland Do you make a time for reading? How to make sure to fit it in? #ELTChinwag
@EAPstephen Of course! You can't wait for people to notice what you need. It was more of a memo to self. #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland I'm really bad at using reading for CPD. It says more about me that the reading. I much prefer to talk the ideas out #ELTChinwag
@EAPstephen Good management should encourage teachers to vary what they do, or try new things. Otherwise you get stale. #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland @ITLegge Yeah! It seems like it shouldn't work. But it does. #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland As a trainer trying to practice what I preach has had the biggest impact. #ELTChinwag
@teacher27 @ELTIreland Hear hear! It can be hard to break free of the tried and tested strategies and try the unknown. #ELTChinwag
@GlenysHanson @j_s_mitten @IATEFL_LAMSIG You don't always have solve everything sometimes the role of manager is to encourage. #ELTChinwag
@ITLegge Hi Helen! Nice to meet you in digital again. Having met you in person at #DigELT2015 #ELTChinwag
I always think the best CPD for a teacher is being a student for a while, whether it is learning a language or learning to dance #ELTChinwag
@j_s_mitten @IATEFL_LAMSIG I liked the idea of the coach / manager that I heard about from that. #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland Went to Digital ELT Ireland last weekend. #ELTChinwag  #DigELT2015
@teacher27 Don't forget to use the hashtag #ELTChinwag
@teacher27 Good work!
@j_s_mitten It should be an interesting one. #eltchinwag

RT @ELTIreland: You've been quoted in the #ELTChinwag summary for the chat on "Assessment and Testing" https://t.co/HmGzHANmO3
RT @ELTIreland: We'll be at Digital ELT Ireland next weekend. Watch out for the tweets from there if you are interested. #ELTChinwag
@EdLaur How was the conference in Poland? I was supposed to go but didn't make it in the end.
@eilymurphy I haven't heard of Bulats #ELTChinwag
@eilymurphy @languageeteach @ELTIreland What's your working definition of test versus assessment? #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland I do worry about this. Trying to make sure I get a second opinion on the forms of assessment I use. #ELTChinwag
@eilymurphy @ELTIreland I was once told TOEIC was a very reliable test of something or other (i.e. not English) #ELTChinwag
@eilymurphy @ELTIreland Oh now! They couldn't have picked worse. #ELTChinwag
@LizziePinard @languageeteach @ELTIreland Advantage is that you can use a regular communicative activity as the "test" this way. #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland I am in the camp that says the big exams are strangling language teaching. Try to avoid as much as possible. #ELTChinwag
@eilymurphy @ELTIreland I did this with written work as learner training and then had them compare mine and negotiate change #ELTChinwag
@languageeteach @ELTIreland At a workshop recently I heard how in-class progress was monitored with a check list not a test. #ELTChinwag
@languageeteach @eilymurphy @LizziePinard I always give them the comments to look at before the grade so that they read them. #ELTChinwag
@LizziePinard Back to Aesop! Can't please all the people all the time. #ELTChinwag
@EdLaur And their previous experience of learning in school means they don't have a warm feeling towards grading. #ELTChinwag
@eilymurphy @LizziePinard Does the comments bit actually become the most valuable part of the report? #ELTChinwag
@EdLaur I salute you! That's exactly what I would like to be doing. #ELTChinwag
@LizziePinard Teachers tend to have been the student who did well in tests. It's the one who don't that we need to watch for. #ELTChinwag
@eilymurphy @ELTIreland For the benefit of the learners? Or for the benefit of the system (Company HR, Ministry of Ed etc.) #ELTChinwag
@LizziePinard e.g. Homework doesn't need to be graded. More useful to give feedback and an opportunity to improve. #ELTChinwag
@EdLaur I wouldn't be too sure. #ELTChinwag
@languageeteach @EdLaur Politically motivated. Never bother to do needs a analysis or make it relevant to the learners. #ELTChinwag
@LizziePinard If I had my way ... Lots of formative feedback and the minimum of grading. #ELTChinwag
@ELTIreland I like the culmination of all the work and the sense of achievement but nothing worse than when they crash and burn. #ELTChinwag
@EdLaur The teaching of Irish is the epitome of a failure in language teaching. It should be studied for what not to do. #ELTChinwag
@languageeteach @ELTIreland I wonder if we would be teachers if we didn't like tests to some extent. #ELTChinwag
@EdLaur @ELTIreland I have friends like that. They took the end of term exam as a competitive sport and trained like an athlete #ELTChinwag
@EdLaur I think you did but I lost track of the tweet and never got around to replying. Myself and Mia ran for a train together.
@ELTIreland Hi all how would you assess your evenings? #ELTChinwag
Preparing to moderate this evening's #eltchinwag on assessment and testing at 8:30 from @ELTIreland Tweet me If you have points to include.
@theteacher73 @ELTIreland @TeachingEnglish True that! We should have summed it up in a tweet instead. :))
